reviewText:
Early Access Review

Nice art style and plays well with the story so far has been well executed. The first update was out in three days and they have a well thought out KickStarter that gives me confidence that they will deliver on this title

and you can jump and do an action dive, I can't tell you how important it is to me to be able to mindlessly jump around while i'm walking in an RPG

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is a nice twist on the RPG formula that answers the age old question of how people would react to being robbed of their goods. Unfortunately the game still has some issues, including (in my experience) a choppy framerate and some other bugs. Since it is early access, I'd still reccommend it if you can go in knowing there will be bugs.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Chapter 1 and Chapter 2 are practicaly all complete, at the moment I would suggest getting the game until it's out of early release, but for the price and the preview/ yet to be full game it's ok.

other problemes seen though, are

* Crashing in Chapter 3.
* Can't hit monsters with melee weapons sometimes.
* Falling in Chapter 1 counts as falling in the tower.
* First boss has an unforgiving attack that practicaly always hits.
* Dead ends that look like they may lead somewhere, but don't.

These problems, once fixed, will make the game more enjoyable.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Disclaimer: This was written on 08/02/15. The final game might change significantly.

This game riffs the genre of JRPGs but it's mechanically closer to Legend of Zelda, at least at first. You solve environmental and logic puzzles. You do fetch quests for villagers (in one case literally). It's script is a fun romp through the bizzare rules of old jRPGs where we suspend or belief for certain things, though whether or not we should is an open question. It's also got some interesting themes forshadowed in the main story that I look forward to see pan out down the road.

I really want to like this game, and sometimes I do. I just take issue with engine problems. The game will slow to a crawl during heavy action sequences. My laptop is a couple years old, but it can play Crysis and Dark Souls 2, games that demand a fast computer. Again, the game IS still in beta and I'm confident the developers WILL iron out these kinks by the time it goes gold.

If you're looking for something different, and you don't mind paying for a beta version, give it a try. Caveat Empor
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As mentioned, this is an early access review - a very early access, in fact. Not all the chapters have been included, nor much of the side quests, but the strength of this game lies very much in its 4th wall breaking humor where the players get the enjoy how silly the RPG genre actually is if you're living through a side-character's life.

You Are Not The Hero makes you feel like you're one of those characters that the Hero accidently affects but players would normally not notice as anything other than a 'background' of a party member. One of those major NPCs that makes things happen, but you would normally not see how much work goes into making those things happen.

However, as I mentioned this is currently on very early access - I cannot recommend the game right now unless you intend to support the creators. Maybe when they release all the main storyline would I recommend the game as it is rather buggy and incomplete as it is.
